definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: China did indeed slide into disarray, warlordism and insurrection after 1911.
sentences.chinese: 1911年後的中國確實陷入了軍閥混戰的亂局。

definition: (of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
turbulent situation/changing (face, scene, situation, world of etc)
could happen at any moment/on the verge

pinyin: mao4 yi4 bao3 hu4 zhu3 yi4

definition: principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
